ch.aplu.ev3

Class NxtTurtleRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.ev3.LegoRobot
      • ch.aplu.ev3.NxtTurtleRobot

  • public class NxtTurtleRobot
extends LegoRobot
    Implementation of the basic Logo turtle movements. Motors should be plugged into port A and B.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NxtTurtleRobot()
      Creates a TurtleLegoRobot instance.
      NxtTurtleRobot(boolean waitStart)
      Creates TurtleLegoRobot instance and delays execution until the user presses the ENTER button.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Moves the turtle backward the given number of steps.
      NxtTurtleRobot forward(int steps)
      Moves the turtle forward the given number of steps.
      NxtGear getGear()
      Returns the gear used as component of the turtle.
      int getTurtleSpeed()
      Returns the current turtle speed.
      NxtTurtleRobot left(int angle)
      Turns the turtle to the left for the given angle.
      NxtTurtleRobot right(int angle)
      Turns the turtle to the right for the given angle.
      NxtTurtleRobot setTurtleSpeed(int speed)
      Sets the turtle speed to the given value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NxtTurtleRobot

        public NxtTurtleRobot(boolean waitStart)
        Creates TurtleLegoRobot instance and delays execution until the user presses the ENTER button.
        Parameters:
        waitStart - if true, the execution is stopped until the ENTER button is hit.

      • NxtTurtleRobot

        public NxtTurtleRobot()
        Creates a TurtleLegoRobot instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getGear

        public NxtGear getGear()
        Returns the gear used as component of the turtle.
        Returns:
        the reference of the NxtGear instance

      • setTurtleSpeed

        public NxtTurtleRobot setTurtleSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the turtle speed to the given value. The TurtleRotationSpeed remains unchanged. The speed will be changed to the new value at the next movement call only.
        Parameters:
        speed - 0..100
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • getTurtleSpeed

        public int getTurtleSpeed()
        Returns the current turtle speed.
        Returns:
        speed 0..100

      • forward

        public NxtTurtleRobot forward(int steps)
        Moves the turtle forward the given number of steps. The methods blocks until the turtle is at the final position. The actual distance depends on the "TurtleStepFactor" as defined in the ev3jlib.properties file. The turtle speed corresponds to the "TurtleSpeed" as defined in ShareConstants interface.
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps to go.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • backward

        public NxtTurtleRobot backward(int steps)
        Moves the turtle backward the given number of steps. The methods blocks until the turtle is at the final position. The actual distance depends on the "TurtleStepFactor" as defined in the ev3jlib.properties file. The turtle speed corresponds to the "TurtleSpeed" as defined in the ev3jlib.properties file.
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps to go.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • left

        public NxtTurtleRobot left(int angle)
        Turns the turtle to the left for the given angle. The methods blocks until the turtle is at the final position. Due to the construction of the EV3 the accuracy is limited. It depends on the "TurtleRotationFactor" and the "TurtleRotationSpeed" as defined in the ev3jlib.properties file.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle in degree to rotate.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining

      • right

        public NxtTurtleRobot right(int angle)
        Turns the turtle to the right for the given angle. The methods blocks until the turtle is at the final position. Due to the construction of the EV3 the accuracy is limited. It depends on the "TurtleRotationFactor" and the "TurtleRotationSpeed" as defined in the ev3jlib.properties file.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle in degree to rotate.
        Returns:
        the object reference to allow method chaining
